actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Measure called up by special rule in House.
Measure passed House, amended, in lieu of H.R. 3377.

official_title: An Act authorizing the Wichita Indian Tribe of Oklahoma, and its affiliated bands and groups of Indians, to file with the Indian Claims Commission any of their claims against the United States for lands taken without adequate compensation, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended, in lieu of H.R. 3377) Confers jurisdiction upon the Indian Claims Commission, under the Act of August 13, 1946, to hear any claims of the Wichita Indian Tribe and its affiliated bands and groups with respect to land taken without adequate compensation by the United States. Requires any such claims filed by any affiliated bands or groups to be held in common with the Wichita Indian Tribe. Provides for the transfer of claims filed with the commission to the Court of Claims.

titles.title: A bill authorizing the Wichita Indian Tribe of Oklahoma, and its affiliated bands and groups of Indians, to file with the Indian Claims Commission any of their claims against the United States for lands taken without adequate compensation.
